basics.name: Tinghui Zhu
basics.label: CS Master Student at Fudan University
basics.summary: CS Master Student at Fudan University

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: National Scholarship
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: MciteBench: A Benchmark for Multimodal Citation Text Generation in MLLMs
publications.summary: We introduce MCiteBench, the first benchmark designed to evaluate and analyze the multimodal citation text generation ability of MLLMs. Our benchmark comprises data derived from academic papers and review-rebuttal interactions, featuring diverse information sources and multimodal content.

publications.name: Unraveling Cross-Modality Knowledge Conflicts in Large Vision-Language Models
publications.summary: We formally define the problem of cross-modality parametric knowledge conflicts by systematically detecing, interpreting, and mitigating them.

publications.name: From Persona to Personalization: A Survey on Role-Playing Language Agents
publications.summary: A survey on Role-Playing Language Agents.

publications.name: How Easily do Irrelevant Inputs Skew the Responses of Large Language Models?
publications.summary: We present a comprehensive investigation into the robustness of LLMs to different types of irrelevant information under various conditions.

publications.name: TravelPlanner: A Benchmark for Real-World Planning with Language Agents
publications.summary: We propose TravelPlanner, a new planning benchmark that focuses on travel planning, a common real-world planning scenario. It provides a rich sandbox environment, various tools for accessing nearly four million data records, and 1,225 meticulously curated planning intents and reference plans.

publications.name: Deductive Beam Search: Decoding Deducible Rationale for Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
publications.summary: Deductive Beam Search, constrained by the principle of deductive reasoning, integrates CoT with step-wise beam search to guide reasoning towards a deducible path.

publications.name: Towards Visual Taxonomy Expansion
publications.summary: We propose Visual Taxonomy Expansion (VTE), introducing visual features into the taxonomy expansion task.

publications.name: SLR:A Million-Scale Comprehensive Crossword Dataset for Simultaneous Learning and Reasoning
publications.summary: We propose a novel crossword-based NLU task that imparts knowledge information to a model by solving crossword clues and simultaneously trains the model to infer new knowledge from existing knowledge.

publications.name: End-to-End Entity Linking with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
publications.summary: We propose to model the Entity Linking task as a hierarchical decision-making process and design a hierarchical reinforcement learning algorithm to solve the problem.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
